intro: Polysphaeria pedunculata var. pedunculata, commonly known as the clustered starwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically divided into narrow segments, and it often grows in moist, temperate environments. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
